terms.definition:
is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Sharp things make you uncomfortable. It's just a matter of time before someone cuts themselves.

You cannot activate or depart with axes, swords, spears, daggers, scythes, or katars in your gear grid.

is a story event in the Lion Knight Expansion rule book.

Event Text.
They awoke to find someone new standing at the center of their settlement. Still as a statue, a lion-like creature with razor claws stood seeing everything and saying nothing. They wondered if it was even alive, but the boldly curious reported an electrifying gaze in its still eyes.
What is this creature? Why is it here?

What is this creature?.
The settlement gains the Stoic Statue innovation. Add Stoic Statue to the settlement's innovations on the settlement record.

Trembling, the survivors deliberate.

Deliberate.
Add Places, Everyone! to the timeline two years from now. Each player nominates 1 survivor, then the group rolls 1d10

If you rolled a 2 or 3 and if the settlement has innovated Drums, they beat them wildly to drive the Lion Knight's gaze out of their minds. A random nominated survivor gains the Coprolalia disorder.

If you rolled a 5, 6, or 7 and if the settlement has innovated Face Painting the survivors cope by decorating their faces in the likeness of the strange arrival. The nominated survivors gain +4 insanity.

If you rolled a 9 or 10 and if the settlement has innovated Symposium, the survivors resolve they must be prepared for whatever good or ill omen portends. Gain the Nightmare Training innovation at no cost and +3 .

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You are afraid of being afraid. You're a nervous wreck, and monsters can smell this in your scent.

At the start of each showdown, gain the priority target token unless you have stinky gear in your gear grid.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You've given up. Nothing seems to matter. You have no concern for your own wellbeing.

You cannot use or gain survival.
You cannot gain courage.

Cure this disorder if you have 8+ understanding.

is a disorder card found within the Dragon King Expansion.

Card Text.
You love numbers. Your life must exist in perfect arithmetical harmony.

When you gain this disorder, roll 1d5. Your movement is that number.

Ignore all other movement modifiers.

is a story event in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game rule book.

Event Text.
You are visited by enigmatic figures, fully-enclosed in armor. They march silently through the settlement. The only noise is a metallic clang, as they pause before each survivor and tap their lantern halberds against the ground. The survivors have no choice but to helplessly await their mute deliberations.

Add King's Man to the nemesis encounter list. The Strangers Count People and take action based on the population total.

Count People.
7 or less
Supportive Action

Finally, one of them drives a lantern halberd into the ground. They leave without a word. Add the Guidepost innovation to the settlement.

The strangers plan to return. Add Armored Strangers to the timeline 4 years from the current year. Roll on the table below.

8 or more
Destructive Action

The strangers finish their count and draw their blades. Roll on the table below.

Resist.
You rise up! Add Special Showdown - King's Man Level 1 to the timeline this year. (after the showdown, heal the returning survivors, then resume this year's settlement phase at the update death count step. Do not gain , draw a settlement event card, or advance a lantern year.)

Ways to Trigger.

is a disorder card found within the Gambler's Chest Expansion.
Card Text.
You have an obsessive fear of imperfection.

When there are no Perfect hits in your attack, suffer 1 brain damage.

Baby and the Sword is a basic hunt event card found in the Fade white box expansion.

Card Text.
The survivors find a woman's corpse riddled with arrows. It rests in the center of a pattern drawn in blood, a screaming infant in one hand, a sword in the other. As the survivors approach, a massive worm bursts from the ground blocking their way! The survivors may Grab & Dash.

Roll a random hunt event if you do not Grab & Dash.

is a seed pattern gear card found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion.

Card Text.
Spend to stab an adjacent survivor! They gain 3 bleeding tokens, -1 movement token, the priority target token, and are knocked down.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Eating is the only thing that helps you escape your miserable life.

You cannot depart unless you have consumable gear in your gear grid.

You must consume if a choice to consume arises.

is a story event in the Dung Beetle Knight Expansion rule book.

Event Text.
The settlement nominates a survivor to be the Gatherer. The Gatherer performs one of the following events, depending on the level of Black Harvest. In addition, the settlement may Unbury Gear that they encased and buried in the Underground Sow story event.

Rotten Acanthus - Level 1.
The Gatherer descends into the darkness. They inhale dangerous vapors, gaining +2 insanity and a random disorder.They return with armfuls of rancid ferns. Picking through them, the settlement finds 2 Fresh Acanthus strange resources. If the Gatherer has Legendary Lungs, they are able to go deep enough to find a half-digested White Lion corpse. Gain 1 random White Lion resource.

This Settlement Phase:
Departing survivors gain +2 survival.

Nightmare Corn - Level 2.
The Gatherer descends into a tunnel. They return with baskets brimming with Nightmare Corn. If the Gatherer has Zero Presence, they harvest safely. Otherwise, kernel growths appear on their spine. Gain the Motion Sickness disorder.

This Settlement Phase:
You may craft gear at the Wet Resin Crafter which needs Nightmare Corn.

Departing survivors gain +2 survival.

Departing survivors that can consume gain to all hit locations. 

Vampiric Artichoke - Level 3.
The Gatherer descends with a team to harvest; the Gatherer is entrusted to serve as bait. The team manages to return with a prized Vampiric Artichoke. Roll 1d10. On a result of 1-8, the Gatherer's blood is drained by the bizarre plant and they die. Regardless, the settlement feasts!

This Settlement Phase:
You may craft gear at the Wet Resin Crafter which needs Vampiric Artichoke.

Departing survivors gain survival up to the survival limit.
Ignore 1 ingredient from any Cooking recipe.

Unbury Gear.
Nominate 1 or more survivors to be Restorers. A survivor cannot be a Restorer if they have endeavored elsewhere this settlement phase. They carefully unbury the encased gear and gingerly work to free the item without damaging it.

All Restorers are exhausted by their task. They cannot depart or spend endeavors this settlement phase.

Each Restorer selects 1 buried gear from storage and rolls 1d10. The group may archive a Scell strange resource to add +4 to all Restorer's roll results this year.

Successful Calcification.
The gear is unburied. Remove it from storage and gain its calcified side. This gear is forever changed, you may only use its calcified version.

Ways to Trigger.

See Also.
Ancient Root

is an innovation card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
 Breathing a Vein - spend 1 resource and roll 1d10.

is a Crimson Crocodile disorder card found within the Gambler's Chest Expansion.

Card Text.
A single glimpse of red and that is all you can see.

Whenever a survivor gains a bleeding token, suffer the frenzy disorder. Limit once per round.

is a disorder card found within the Gambler's Chest Expansion.
Card Text.
You just cannot focus.

You cannot Surge or Concentrate

Contains possible outcomes of excess damage to the Brain location.

Brain Trauma Table.

was basic hunt event #96 found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game 1.3. It was replaced by Cloaked Stranger when the core game updated to 1.5.

Event Text.
The smell of cooking meat draws the survivors to a gigantic black cauldron. The pot is filled with a thick dark stew. Any survivor may choose to consume the stew and roll on the table. Insane survivors (3+ insanity_ and survivors with the Binge Eating disorder must consume.

If a survivor has 3+ understanding they may put a consumable gear or resource into the pot and gain +2 to the roll result.

is a disorder card found within the Frogdog Expansion.
Card Text.
You belong to the water.

You cannot Depart to hunt the Frogdog.

Your delusion prevents you from speaking. You cannot Encourage or participate in Intimacy.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
The survivors pass a forlorn fountain in the shape of a lion's face. A stream of crystal-clear water flows from its mouth. Each survivor consumes the water, gaining +1 survival and +1 courage. Any number of survivors may douse their head in the water and roll 1d10.

is a settlement event card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.
Card Text.
The settlement is hidden behind a thick, green mist. Something about the
way the lantern light passes through it makes it seem alive. Roll 1d10.

is a disorder card found within the Spidicules Expansion.

Card Text.
You are deeply afraid of being the monster controller.

While you are the monster controller, double any damage you suffer.

Cooking is a story event in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game rule book.

Event Text.
The survivors experiment with scraps of foodstuffs. The savory discovery is palatable.

Select 1 cooking recipe and archive the listed resources to create a dish. This settlement phase, 1 survivor may consume the resulting dish and gain the benefit. Any uneaten dishes are lost.

Venison Oso Buco.
1x Nightmare Tick
1x Shank Bone
1x Beast Steak
1x Fresh Acanthus

Feed the tick a beast steak. When the nightmare tick is full, simmer it in the bone marrow of the shank bone over medium lantern heat. Season with fresh acanthus. Yum!

Benefit: +1 permanent evasion, +10 survival

3 Eye Stew.
1x Cyclops Fly
1x Eye of Cat
1x Phoenix Eye
1x Fresh Acanthus

Saute the monster eyes until soft and releasing moisture. Add the cyclops fly and fresh acanthus. Cook at a bare simmer until cyclops fly is tender. Serve warm.

Benefit: +1 permanent accuracy, +10 survival

Sword Beetle Skewer.
1x Sword Beetle
1x Bladder
1x Lion Testes
1x Fresh Acanthus

Cube sword beetle, antelope Bladder, and lion testes into bite-sized pieces. Season cubes with fresh acanthus. Thread the cubes onto straightened scrap pieces. Roast over lantern heat.

Benefit: +1 permanent strength, +10 survival

Stuffed Cockroach.
1x Hissing Cockroach
1x Beast Steak
1x Pustules
1x Fresh Acanthus

Grind beast steak, Combine with fresh acanthus and phoenix pustules. Hollow the hissing cockroach carcass and stuff with mixture. Bake in lantern oven. Delicious!

Benefit: Remove all disorders, gain +10 survival

Ways to Trigger.

See Also.
Nightmare Paella

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You have compulsive tics in the form of sporadic muttering, cursing, whimpering, and screaming.

All your gear is noisy.
You are always a threat unless you are knocked down, even if an effect says otherwise.

' is a strange resource found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. It has the Smong Singers crest, and is therefore only used in campaigns with Smog Singers.

Card text.
You may huff this. Archive it to remove all your disorders and gain one disorder of your choice.

' is the Smog Singers Scout Discovery. It is found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion.
Card text.
Gain the Smog Singers Tablet scout gear.

A fragrant smell leads the scout to a smoking patch of broken stone faces and debris. Heat radiates from below. The survivors dig carefully, exposing a shining pit filled with tasty-looking charred vegetables that sizzle in the shimmering heat. Roll 1d10.

is a story event in the Slenderman Expansion rule book.

Event Text.
The survivor looks on in horror as black water inexplicably pools around their feet. They are imprisoned.

Imprisoned.
Suddenly, the ground gives way. The survivor is swallowed by an angry portal of dark water sloshing on the ground; nothing but damp stone remains in their place. As they plummet into a pitch-black ocean, slimy leaves lash their panicked, drowning body in the darkness.

The survivor gains the Pod Imprisonment survivor status card. They will attempt to break free in subsequent survivor turns.

Struggle.
set the survivor's insanity to 0 and roll 1d10

If you rolled 4 - 9: If the survivor has the Legendary Lungs secret fighting art, the crushing waters are no challenge. Use the Free at Last result instead.

Ways to Trigger.

is a Strange Resource found within the Slenderman Expansion.

Card Text.
You may consume and archive this to remove all your disorders, then gain a random disorder.

is a disorder card found within the Lion God Expansion.

Card Text.
Predators of all shapes and sizes find your scent irresistible.

You are still considered a threat when you are knocked down (unless you use an effect that says otherwise).

is a disorder card found within the Frogdog Expansion.
Card Text.
Incoherent revelry overtakes you.

All your gear is noisy.

On Arrival, draw two random survivor attribute tokens, honoring the side they are drawn on.

is a dragon trait and disorder card found within the Dragon King Expansion.

Card Text.
You have a grand destiny that you must fulfill.

If you do not depart, lose all survival and insanity.

An impairment. You cannot be nominated for Intimacy. This injury is permanent and can be recorded once. Gain a random disorder. You are knocked down. Gazing upwards, you wonder at the futility of your struggle. Gain +3 insanity.

is a disorder card found within the Gambler's Chest Expansion.
Card Text.
You have extreme difficulty distinguishing left from right and up from down.

Your can only be spent to move in a single straight line.

is a disorder card found within the Black Knight Expansion.
Card Text.
There is no high road.

You cannot depart unless you are insane.

Gain +1 speed while attacking a monster that is knocked down or from its blind spot.

is a disorder card found within the Sunstalker Expansion.

Card Text.
You don't have any emotions. You've hidden this from everyone by mimicking their social interactions.

You cannot gain +1 strength tokens.

is a disorder card found within the Lion God Expansion.

Card Text.
You are a delicate flower, wilting in the darkness.

It takes one less bleeding token to kill you.

is a disorder card found within the Frogdog Expansion.
Card Text.
That's just nasty.

When you gain a stink token, gain +1 insanity.

You must depart with stinky gear in you gear grid.

Trivia.
 is a condition in which people are sexually attracted to flatulence.

is a disorder card found within the Gambler's Chest Expansion.
Card Text.
You cannot bear the thought of working. You hide away whenever you might be needed.

When you are a returning survivor, you do not generate Endeavors.

You cannot endeavor.

The Exhausted Lantern Hoard is a settlement location found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game. It is unlocked during the Blackout story event and replaces the Lantern Hoard settlement location.

Location Text.
Dead Guardian.
The sleeping predator is gone. Without its protective presence, intelligent monsters draw near.
You may only hunt Lvl 3+ monsters.
All departing survivors must have 1 gear with the lantern keyword in their gear grid.
If the settlement has the Final Lantern, 1 survivor must depart with it in their gear grid.
The light of innovation is extinguished. You cannot innovate.
 Lantern Research - Pulse Discoveries
Cost: 
 Oxidation
Cost: 
Survivors' Lantern
Cost: 
Investigate.
Roll 1d10.
You descend into the spherical chamber beneath the Lantern Hoard. The air inside is poison, you hold your breath.

Faceless Statue is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
The survivors come upon a faceless statue holding a shining lantern. Basking in the warm light, the survivors are renewed, Each survivor gains 1 survival.

If the settlement has Sculpture, the survivors deeply appreciate the artist's subtle craftsmanship. Each survivor rolls 1d10. Gain that many survival and +1 understanding.

The survivors may rest here longer. If they do, each survivor heals all injury levels and lost armor points on 1 hit location. However, they lose track of their quarry. Move it 1 space away from the survivors on the hunt board. If a survivor heals more than 5 lost armor points this way, they stare into the shining light for too long and gain 1 random disorder.

If all survivors are insane, they cannot rest longer.

is a story event in the Dragon King Expansion rule book.

Event Text.
Suddenly, a second heartbeat pulses in your eardrum, a second spirit roars in your breast. You look up, locking eyes with an enormous shrouded face visible to your eyes only. It is the face of the stars and you are one of the People of the Stars.

When a survivor gains all Dragon Traits in a row or column, they are reborn as one of the People of the Stars under that constellation.

For the rest of their life, the Tyrant will consider them a member of his clan, worthy of succession.

If a survivor gains more than one constellation at once, choose one. A survivor may gain one constellation per lifetime.

In the moment of their rebirth, the People of the Stars may consume their lies or sins in an ecstatic self-mutilating ritual that scars their face in the Tyrant's image.

Choose one:
Consume Sins: Remove all permanent injuries and gain the Vestiphobia disorder.
Consume Lies: Remove all disorders and suffer the Broken Jaw severe head injury.
When a survivor gains a constellation, the experience alters the very fiber of their being. The celestial face of their vision becomes a mirror, and they are the reflection.

Draw the constellation card that corresponds to the constellation of the survivor gained. Record the rules and abilities associated with it and adjust your permanent attributes as listed.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You cannot bear the oppressive darkness any longer.

You retire.

If you gain this disorder during a hunt or showdown, you put on a brave face until you return to the settlement, vowing never to leave the Lantern Hoard again.

is a story event in the Gorm Expansion rule book.

Event Text.
The survivors lay a trap to discover the elusive final resting place of the ancient Gorm.

Nominate a survivor to become the Ancient Gorm's Bait and be removed from the Hunt. During the Hunt Phase, when the Ancient Gorm's Bait would be the hunt event revealer, they are Digested instead. Move the survivors along the Hunt Board as normal. At the start of the showdown, each non-bait survivor makes a Timid Entrance and the Ancient Gorm's Bait is placed, knocked down, adjacent to the monster.

Digested.
Roll 1d10.

The survivor runs wildly into the path of the lumbering ancient Gorm, wriggling its body like an ecstatic worm. The sinewy arms of the Gorm's sagging maw snatch them up. The rest of the survivors follow the bait's lantern light that shows through the ancient Gorm's distended, papery gut.

Timid Entrance.
Each survivor rolls 1d10.

If you rolled a 10 on Timid Entrance: If you have no survival when you approach the pool, your exhaustion makes you stumble. As you emerge, the tar seems permanently stuck to your body, granting newfound stability. Gain 1 Gormite strange resource and the Immovable Object secret fighting art.

Ways to Trigger.

is a disorder card found within the Flower Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
An insatiable hunger has bloomed in you, delicate and sickeningly sweet.

You may only depart to hunt the Flower Knight. After you depart, cure this disorder.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
There is a great rush of air. A booming, inhuman voice declares a single word in an unknown language. For one instant, the survivors understand.

All non-deaf survivors gain +1 understanding and suffer 1 brain event damage. If they are insane they also gain 1 random disorder.

is an advanced Butcher AI card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.

Pick Target.
closest threat, facing
closest threat
no target: menace

Move & Intimidate Target.
The Butcher looms over the target, mere inches from their face.

If the Butcher is adjacent to the target, roll 1d10. On a result of 3+, target suffers brain damage equal to the monster's level, is knocked down, gains +2 understanding, and gains a random disorder.

is a disorder card found within the Flower Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
You cannot experience fear if you do not exist.

Double all insanity you gain.

Double all survival you spend.

is a settlement event card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
The settlement calls out to the returning survivors in a chorus of unknown tongues. Each survivor in the settlement begins to speak in their own incomprehensible language until all the sounds of the settlement are replaced with a never-ending babble. Nominate 1 survivor.

Lingering Effects.
Glossolalia prevents Science Endeavors.
Glossolalia prevents Education Endeavors.
Automatic Writing - roll 1d10.
 Requires Pictograph

Deep Listen - Spend 2 resources.
Without language to distract them, the settlement learns to time their movements to the beating of their hearts. Departing survivors gain +1 movement token. Endeavor here once per settlement phase.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
The way forward is blocked by dense, gold-flecked smoke. If the survivors have a Final Lantern, it guides them through the smoke without any trouble; end this event.

The survivors may push ahead and brave the smoke. If they do, each survivor gains +1 courage and the event revealer rolls 1d10. If they don't brave the smoke, they take the long way around; roll again on the hunt event table before moving on the hunt board.

The survivors carefully descend into the crater, finding the ruins of a settlement surrounded by a ring of skulls. The settlement is absolutely demolished and almost everything has been ground to powder from some tremendous force. The skulls face away from the ruins and in each gaping mouth, a golden ember spews smoke.

The sight is haunting; each survivor suffers 1d10 brain event damage and gains 1 random disorder. The survivors gingerly sift through the ruins. Nominate a survivor to investigate and roll 1d10.

 

Notes.
This event erroneously refers to the Shattered Jaw severe injury as "broken jaw". Additionally, there is a typo in the second roll table under roll result "1", that reads "...its sputtering hiss rining in your ears..."

Golden Light is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
A golden light blinds the survivors, stopping them in their tracks. The light shines from a single source. The event revealer is compelled to investigate. They gain +1 courage and roll 1d10.

If the event revealer is blind, they walk in the wrong direction and gain +3 insanity. Roll again on the hunt event table and do not investigate the light.

Harvester is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
This event cannot be rerolled or avoided in any way. 

The ground quakes and cracks beneath the survivors. A colossal worm bursts from below, its skin a mosaic of screaming faces. The mere sight of it is maddening .

All survivors gain 1 random disorder and must spend 1 survival or be devoured whole. If any survivor has noisy gear, the Harvester is drawn to the sound and they are instantly devoured. Nothing can save them.

The creature is so horrifying that the survivors' brains erase the experience from their memories. Do not gain the benefits of your death principle.

Head-Splitting Pain is a Gorm hunt event card found in the Gorm Expansion.

Card Text.
An approaching flash of light causes terrible convulsions. Move the Gorm 1 space closer to the survivors on the hunt board. If it moves into the survivors' space, they are ambushed. Otherwise, each survivor rolls on the table. Add their number of disorders to their result.

1d10 - Each survivor, one at a time

is a settlement event card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
It is impossibly hot. Any returning survivors with heavy or fur gear have heat stroke and may not depart this Lantern Year.
Lingering Effects.
The heat wave prevents Science and :Category:Education Innovations endeavors.
If you depart with heavy gear in your grid, set your survival to zero after applying all bonuses.
Find Fluid - roll 1d10.

Breathe Fumes - roll 1d10.

Superheated Beverage.
Requires Cooking
1x Fresh Acanthus
5x Organ
4x Bone
Gain +1 permanent strength.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
The mere sight of blood makes you lightheaded, and serious gore can knock you out!

During the showdown, whenever a survivor (including you) gains a bleeding token, you are knocked down.

is a story event in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game rule book.

Event Text.
The survivors consume herbs and berries. All survivors gain +1 survival.

Each survivor must make a special gathering roll.

To make a gathering roll, a survivor nominates any number of d10s and rolls them. If two or more die results are the same, your score is 0. Otherwise, add all your die results to determine your gathering score.

Add all survivors' gathering scores to make a single final score and consult the Herb Exploration table.

Add +10 to the final score if the survivors have passed the Overwhelming Darkness space on the hunt board.

Explore the Swamp.
Roll 1d10. If you have an Almanac, roll twice and select which result to keep.

Eat the Fruit.
If a survivor consumes a second shining fruit they die instantly. Otherwise, roll on the table.

Ways to Trigger.

A disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You compulsively collect and stash anything you can get your hands on. Every little bit you add to your secret hoard makes your existence feel more real.

Whenever you are a returning survivor, archive 1 resource gained from the last showdown and gain +1 courage.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You believe in honor and fairness when conducting yourself on the battlefield. It is these strong principles that have kept you alive, and you will not abandon them under any circumstances.

You cannot attack a monster from its blind spot or if it is knocked down.

is a disorder card found within the Slenderman Expansion.

Card Text.
Your will to survive has become indefatigable.

You may dodge one additional time per round.

Whenever you are hit by an attack, you must dodge at least once, if possible.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Whether you are running, fiddling with your gear, or pacing, you are always moving.

During the showdown, you must move at least 1 space every round.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You are immortal! You will live forever and cannot be killed.

While you are insane, convert all damage dealt to your hit locations to brain damage.

You are so busy reveling in your own glory that you cannot spend survival while insane.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Past decisions haunt you ceaselessly. You are crippled by indecision, and even the most trivial choices grip you with terror.

If you are the event revealer of hunt events that call on you to make a roll, roll twice and use the lower result.

Intimacy is a story event in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game rule book.

Event Text.
Nominate one consenting male and one consenting female survivor and roll on the Intimacy table below.

The first time your settlement gives birth to a new survivor (gains +1 population from intimacy), the survivors ponder existence. Principle: New Life.

As your settlement grows in size, don't forget to apply your chosen New Life Principle. It will greatly effect the outcome of your campaign.

Intimacy.

If you rolled a 7 or 8 and if the settlement has innovated Bed, the new survivor gains +1 permanent strength.

If you rolled a 10 and if the settlement has innovated Hovel, and they do not already have a Savior, a Special Child is born.

Special Child.
On this day, everyone remembers the birth of a very special child. Where they step, hope flourishes. Birth of a Savior.

Ways to Trigger.

See Also.
Infant Adrift
Intimacy (Dragon King Expansion)
Intimacy (Sunstalker Expansion)

is a story event in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game rule book.

Event Text.
The survivor that dealt the killing blow feels their heart sink.

Tragedy befalls the survivor that kills the King's Man. Their body starts to sweat profusely and their flesh bubbles with extreme heat. The survivor must roll a hit location dice on the King's Curse table. A survivor cannot gain more than one piece of regal gear per lantern year.

Every piece of the Regal Armor set is cursed.

Cursed: This may not be removed from your gear grid for any reason. When you die, archive this card.

When a survivor completes the Regal Armor set (has all 5 pieces), they lose their humanity and become a King's Man. Filled with a sense of urgent purpose, the survivor marches off into the darkness.

The survivor can no longer be controlled by a player. Discard their record sheet. They are dead.

King's Curse.
Roll hit location die. Re-roll until you roll a location that is not wearing regal armor1.

Ways to Trigger.

Notes.
This story event erroneously refers to the Regal Greaves, and the Regal Gauntlet as Regal Boots and Regal Gauntlets respectively.
1: If a piece of regal armor would replace a piece of armor in your gear grid, the armor is sent to the settlement storage rather than archived.

is a legendary Phoenix AI card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.

While is in play, the Phoenix gains +4 toughness tokens.

When is drawn face up, the Phoenix heals all wounds. Remove all negative attribute tokens. Return any persistent injuries to the hit location deck and shuffle it.

Survivors with age tokens are mysteriously affected. They gain +2 survival and +2 insanity, restore all armor points, heal all injury levels, and remove all permanent injuries, disorders, and tokens (including age tokens).

Then, disdain and archive .

is a basic resource found within the Santa Satan holiday white box expansion.

The Lump of Atnas is only added to the basic resource deck after the conditions for the strain milestone, Atmospheric Change, are met.

Card Text.
Nostrils flare with delight. A pungent, pine scent emanates from the quivering cube.

At the start of the settlement phase, if there are 5 or more Cubes of Atnas in settlement storage, their scent draws a survivor, sniffing through the darkness. Gain +1 population, this survivor has a random disorder.

Notes.
Cubes of Atnas include this resource as well as the resources included in the Deathmas whiteboxes, e.g. Lungs of the Sword Saint in the Deathmas Cockroach Queen box.

is a disorder card found within the Black Knight Expansion.
Card Text.
You are not sure-footed.

When you end your movement on terrain, you are knocked down.

is a disorder card found within the Gorm Expansion.

Card Text.
Even large, looming shadows make you jumpy.

You may not depart for hunts or showdowns with monsters that occupy more than 4 spaces on the showdown board.

is a story event in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game rule book.
Event Text.
Every survivor with a Pickaxe rolls on the Mineral Gathering table.

Mineral Gathering.
Roll 1d10.

Worm Tunnels.
Roll 1d10. Add +2 to the result if you have a Sickle.

Crystal Lake.
Roll 1d10. Add +2 to the result if you have a Whip.

Lantern City.
Roll 1d10. Add +2 to the result if you have Almanac.

Ways to trigger Mineral Gathering.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Monsters make you feel bad. Really, really bad.

Whenever you suffer brain damage from an intimidate action, suffer 1 additional brain damage.

is a disorder card found within the Dung Beetle Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
Moving quickly makes you want to vomit.

Whenever you would suffer knockback, gain 1 bleeding tokens instead.

is a disorder card found within the Flower Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
There is nothing in the world more beautiful than yourself.

You may not wear armor at the head location. If you are wearing armor at the head location when you gain this disorder, archive it.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
Your miserable sleep is plagued with mind-bending nightmares. Each survivor rolls 1d10. If the result is greater than their insanity, they learn something from the waking horror and gain +1 understanding. Otherwise, they gain 1 random disorder.

If any survivor is a savior or has the Extra Sense fighting art, they disappear into the dream, emerging from the darkness hours later. They gain +4 Hunt XP and a random basic resource.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
The event revealer falls to their knees, sobbing uncontrollably. They've simply had too much. They lose 1d10 survival and gain 1 random disorder.

If the settlement has Accept Darkness, the event revealer embraces their despair. Roll 1d10.

If the settlement has Collective Toil, they slowly pull themselves to their feet, promising to never give up hope. Roll 1d10.

Notes.
In the opening of the text, the event directs players to lose "d10 survival", without referencing the number of d10 that a player is supposed to roll.

is a disorder card found within the Sunstalker Expansion.

Card Text.
You love the feeling of being needed.

When an adjacent survivor is knocked down, you are also knocked down as
you rush to their aid.

Notes.
The Sacred Pool settlement location erroneously refers to the non-existent "Protective" disorder.

is a disorder card found within the Gambler's Chest Expansion.
Card Text.
You refuse to fight.

You cannot activate a weapon to attack. Ignore this if you are frenzied

An ability. When you gain this ability, add the name of your partner. Partners may only nominate each other for Intimacy. When you partner dies, gain a random disorder and lose this ability.

See Also.
Devoted Union
Enduring Legacy

is a disorder card found within the Dragon King Expansion.

Card Text.
You're not ready to love.

You cannot be nominated for Intimacy.

Cure this disorder if you have 8+ courage.

is a Crimson Crocodile disorder card found within the Gambler's Chest Expansion.
Card Text.
You fear fear.

At the start of your act, if you have 0 insanity, gain the Terrified survivor status card.

is a disorder card found within the Gambler's Chest Expansion.
Card Text.
You cling to light.

You cannot depart without a lantern in your gear grid.

is a Flower Knight hunt event card found in the Flower Knight Expansion.
Card Text.
The survivors find a glowing pool of inky black water. A shimmering shape swims languidly in the depths. One survivor may nominate themselves to investigate. If they do, they roll on the table.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
The last hunt was harrowing. All you can do is cower and relive the trauma. Only time can heal your wounds.

Next settlement phase, you do not contribute or participate in any endeavors.
Skip the next hunt to recover.Kingdom Death Twitter post: When you skip the next hunt phase Post-Traumatic Stress is removed from your survivor record sheet.

References.

is a Dung Beetle Knight hunt event card found in the Dung Beetle Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
You find a training ground of sorts. Roll 1d10.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You are prey. All there is for you is death.

You may not spend survival unless you are insane.

is a disorder card found within the Lion Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
The double-edged sword of fame is the only weapon you require.

Each survivor turn, you must take your act first (roll off each turn if multiple survivors have this disorder).

is a story event in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game rule book.

Event Text.
The group must decide how to raise their young. Choose one.

Without Mercy.
The toys are taken from the child and replaced with a cold, stone face shard. Training begins immediately.

The settlement gains the New Life Principle: Survival of the Fittest. Find and place the card on the settlement board and note it on the settlement record sheet.

After adding the card to the settlement roll 1d10.

With Affection.
The settlement embraces the child with warm arms. Nurturing new life is their highest calling.

The settlement gains the New Life Principle: Protect the Young. Find and place the card on the settlement board and note it on the settlement record sheet. 

After adding the card to the settlement roll 1d10.

Note.
If you are currently working your way through the First Story, return to the settlement section and continue the develop step.

An ability. Once per showdown, you may eat an adjacent survior's disorder. If you do, remove the disorder. They gain 1 bleeding token and you gain +1 permanent strength. At the end of the showdown, if you haven't eaten a disorder, you die.

is a disorder card found within the Black Knight Expansion.
Card Text.
You are afraid to fall.

When you suffer knockback, suffer monster level brain damage.

is a story event in the Spidicules Expansion rule book.

Event Text.
By the time your body is freed from the stalk, all of your blood has been replaced.

Immediately after the killing blow is struck, you are Cut Free from the monster's forehead stalk, your eyes rolling and mouth foaming as your fellow survivors frantically attempt to rouse you!

If the settlement innovated Bloodletting, your fellow survivors treat your head wound with giant leeches. You may proceed to the 9-10 result without rolling.

Cut Free.
roll 1d10

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You carry the weight of your settlement on your shoulders. Everyone is counting on you to save them, and you will rise to the challenge.

If you are insane when you depart, gain +1 survival and +1 strength token.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Your rage boils out of control, causing you to see red at the slightest provocation.

Whenever you suffer a severe injury, also suffer the frenzy brain trauma.

is a disorder card found within the Spidicules Expansion.

Card Text.
When a fellow hunter perishes, you lose control.

When a survivor dies during the showdown, suffer the Frenzy brain trauma.

Run Away is a story event in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game rule book.

Event Text.
Roll 1d10 on the table that corresponds to the current game phase.

Hunt Phase.

Showdown Phase.

Ways to Trigger.

is an innovation card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
 Death Ritual - roll 1d10

is a disorder card found within the Gambler's Chest Expansion.
Card Text.
You take pleasure in others' suffering.

When another survivor suffers a severe injury, you are overcome with glee. You are knocked down and gain +1 insanity.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You love secrets. So much, in fact, that you pretend to have many.

When you are a returning survivor, you quickly become preoccupied with your own affairs. You must skip the next hunt to deal with them.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Lingering damage from your head injuries has caused you to experience periods of uncontrollable shaking and absence of thought.

During the showdown, whenever you suffer damage to your head location, you are knocked down.

is a Dragon King Hit Location card found in the Dragon King Expansion.
Card Text.
Reflex.
The Dragon King stares you down. Gain a random disorder.If you are insane, gain another random disorder.

Critical Wound.
Gain 2 Horn Fragment Dragon King resources.

is a Spidicules Monster Resource found in the Spidicules Expansion.

Card Text.

Requires Nightmare Training 

 Razor Push-ups - roll 1d10

is a disorder card found within the Lion Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
Yelling makes you feel light-headed.

When you encourage, you are knocked down.

is a story event in the Dung Beetle Knight Expansion.

Lore.
There was once a lonely beetle that was hopelessly attracted to Phoenix droppings. Their strange qualities evolved the beetle rapidly. One day, the Phoenix migrated to a sacred grove and the beetle's food came under the fierce protection of a Flower Knight. The beetle emulated the knight in order to reach its meals without incurring the guardian's wrath.

Aftermath.
Victory.
+1 Hunt XP
+1 Weapon Proficiency (if eligible)
+Rewards

Rewards.
The group investigates the large Resin Dung Ball and the network of tunnels beneath the battleground. Inside the ball they find a caustic, but mineral rich, substance. Rolling aside the ball, they find passageways leading deeper underground. After collecting rewards, Spelunking of Death.

The group gains the following rewards:

Level 1
6 Basic, 4 Dung Beetle Knight resources
2 Caustic Preserved Dung strange resources

Level 2
7 Basic, 6 Dung Beetle Knight resources
3 Caustic Preserved Dung strange resources
1 Scell strange resource

Level 3
8 Basic, 8 Dung Beetle Knight resources
3 Caustic Preserved Dung strange resources
1 Scell strange resource
1 Calcified Juggernaut Blade rare gear

The first time the settlement defeats the Dung Beetle Knight after they innovated Storytelling, add Secret Meeting to the timeline 2 years from now.

Defeat.
Nominate 4 survivors. They discover the corpses of the defeated survivors just outside the settlement. The bodies are mere husks, missing their internal organs. The nominated survivors gain +1 insanity, a random disorder, and must depart the next settlement phase, if possible.

is a story event in the Spidicules Expansion rule book.

Event Text.
Strange possibilities are proffered to those bold enough to gamble with their own flesh.

Nominate a survivor to be the patient and Operate! If any survivor has the Silk Surgeon secret fighting art, you may choose the 10 result without rolling.

Operate!.
roll 1d10

If you rolled 10: If any survivor in the settlement has the Silk Surgeon secret fighting art, that survivor collects a finger as payment and increases their Silk Surgeon level by 1. The nominated survivor rolls on the Radical Procedure.

Radical Procedure.
Onlookers watch in awe as needles thread silk across the survivor like an artist's brush on a canvas. The nominated survivor gains a random disorder and rolls a hit location dice. If the settlement has a Silk Surgeon, instead roll dice equal to the level of their secret fighting art and choose one.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
If the settlement does not have Symposium, ignore this event and roll again on the hunt event table before moving on the hunt board. Otherwise, the event revealer suggests a word game to lighten the mood as the survivors trudge forward. The event revealer rolls 1d10. If the settlement has Song of the Brave, add +4 to your roll.

is a disorder card found within the Gambler's Chest Expansion.
Card Text.
You fear what might happen when you fall asleep away from home.

On Arrival, lose half your survival, rounded down.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
The survivors are distracted by a dark crack in the endless sea of stone faces.

If any survivor has a pickaxe, they strike the ground, causing the crack to expand into a gaping hole. Bravely reaching inside the survivor produces a blackened, twisted hunk. Gain 1 Iron strange resource.

Otherwise, each survivor roll 1d10. The lowest scoring survivor (or survivors, in case of ties) becomes a straggler.

The straggler stoops to gaze into the depths and refuses to stop staring. When the other survivors drag them away, they babble incoherently. Whatever they saw changed them forever; they gain 1 random disorder. 

If all survivors end up as stragglers, no one ever pulls them away and they are all lost. Dead.

is a story event in the Spidicules Expansion rule book.

Event Text.
If the settlement already has the Legless Ball innovation, you may choose to skip this event. Otherwise the survivors, roll their still-living captive back to the settlement. The hardships of moving their chittering captive through the changing landscape gives rise to new experiences.

The survivors Gain the Legless Ball and Roll Through the Darkness.

Gain the Legless Ball.
The settlement gains the Legless Ball innovation. Add Legless Ball to the settlement's innovations on the settlement record sheet. If the settlement already has the Legless Ball innovation, gain the Grinning Visage rare gear instead.

Roll Through the Darkness.
roll 1d10

If you rolled a 1 - 2: If the settlement has Protect the Young Principle, the challenge overwhelms the survivors' poor constitutions. 1 random returning survivor is killed, and the Legless Ball is lost (Archive the innovation card.

If you rolled a 5 - 7: If the settlement innovated Nightmare Training, the survivors make sport of the journey while pushing the heavy ball and avoiding its gnashing teeth. Returning Survivors gain +1 permanent Strength.

If you rolled a 9 - 10: If the settlement innovated Cooking, they find tasty bugs caught in the Spidicules' teeth and bag the one that completes their favourite recipe. Add 1 Vermin resource of your choice to settlement storage.

is a disorder card found within the Slenderman Expansion.

Card Text.
The roads in your mind cross and reveal a strange new path.

At the start of the showdown, gain the Darkness Awareness survivor status card.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You can't handle bad smells.

You cannot depart with any stinky gear in your gear grid. If a status or effect would cause you to become stinky, lose all your survival.

is a disorder card found within the Lion Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
You hate being the center of attention.

Whenever you become doomed or gain the priority target token, lose 1 survival.

' is the Crimson Crocodile Scout Discovery. It is found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion.
Card text.
Gain the Crimson Crocodile Tablet scout gear.

In the sudden silence, the scout follows the sound of heavy dripping. Dread fills the survivors as they approach a staircase of clotted blood spiralling up into the darkness. Roll 1d10.

is a disorder card found within the Lion God Expansion.

Card Text.
Freedom awaits those pushed this far beyond the breaking point.

You are always insane, regardless of your insanity.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
Cresting a hill, the survivors find a statue of a man sitting on a throne. If any survivor has 5+ understanding, the survivors may ignore the statue and end this event.

Otherwise, each survivor rolls 1d10. The lowest scoring survivor (roll off in case of ties) becomes a straggler.

The straggler is drawn to the statue, touching it gently. In an instant, they are gone, replaced by the man from the throne, stone mouth open in a silent yell. They are gone forever. Consider them dead, but do not apply Cannibalize death principle; there is no body.

The man offers his thanks and joins the hunting party without any explanation. He is a new survivor with the straggler's gear, 2 random disorders, and 2 Hunt XP. Shuffle all weapon specialization cards (including expansions, if any) and draw one. The survivor has 3 ranks of proficiency in that weapon type. They gain +1d10 survival, +1d10 insanity. Give him a name and +1 survival for being named.

If the settlement has Momento Mori, the statue resembles a deceased survivor. Replace the straggler with the record sheet of a fallen survivor. Remove all of their severe injuries. Set their Hunt XP to 2 (they Age again, as this is a new lifetime). They gain +1d10 survival, +1d10 insanity. You may give them 3 ranks of proficiency in a random weapon type.

Notes.
This hunt event refers to Momento Mori erroneously as "Memento Mori".
This event will trigger Principle: Death. Your society has experienced a loss for the first time so they're deciding what to do when it happens in the future.

is a disorder card found within the Gambler's Chest Expansion.
Card Text.
You are in awe of the majesty of monsters.

When you are knocked down. you are dominated.

When you depart to hunt the The King, remove this disorder.

is a disorder card found within the Sunstalker Expansion.

Card Text.
When your emotions rise, you can only think of violence.

When you have any +1 strength tokens, you cannot dash, dodge or Run Away.

is a disorder card found within the Dragon King Expansion.

Card Text.
Evil magic will be your undoing. You do not believe in abusing the other.

You cannot activate or depart with other gear in your gear grid.

is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
A creaky carriage approaches the survivors. Richly appointed in red and gold, the carriage is carved on every side with lurid faces. A massive, twitching eye dorns the front, while the door of the carriage is a waiting, open mouth.

Out of a small window, a gnarled hand beckons. One survivor with 3+ courage may choose to enter the wagon. They remove one impairment or severe injury and gain 1 random disorder.

A disorder card found within the Beta Challenge PDF.

Card Text.
When you gain this, choose a monster. You may only depart to face the chosen monster.

Your attacks against the chosen monster gain +1 speed and +1 strength.

is a story event in the Spidicules Expansion rule book.

Event Text.
The monster has its revenge on the settlement...

If this event was triggered during the Showdown Phase, nominate the survivor whose name is next to Taken on the timeline, then erase the event. Roll 1d10.

If this event was triggered during the Settlement Phase, nominate the survivor whose name is next to Taken on the timeline, then erase the event. Roll 1d10.

terms.term: The Forest Wants What It Wants
terms.definition:
is a story event in the Flower Knight Expansion rule book and the Spidicules Expansion rule book.

Event Text.
The silence and darkness is broken by a glowing hum that whispers into their bones...

Hunt Board Setup.
When survivors land on the Overwhelming Darkness space, they instead resolve The Forest Wants What It Wants. Survivors may not pass over this space and must stop to resolve this event.

The survivors Test the Gate.

Test the Gate.
roll 1d10

After rolling to Test the Gate, each survivor may do any or all of the following actions once to increase the roll result:
Gain -1 attribute token of your choice. Add +1 to the result.
Gain 1 bleeding token. Add +1 to the result.
Gain 1 random disorder. Add +1 to the result.
Archive 1 gear from your grid. Add +1 to the result.

Ways to Trigger.
relatedTerms: The Forest Wants What It Wants

terms.definition:
is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
The glow of the survivors' lanterns blurs, forming trails of light behind them.

If the settlement has fought a Phoenix, the group recognizes the phenomenon. All survivors gain +1 understanding.

The event revealer rolls 1d10 on the table below. If any survivor has an hours ring, they may instead select a die result.

Notes.
The hunt table erroneously labels the first result as a result of 1-3, while the second result is listed as "3-9", making it unclear as to which result the players would receive if a 3 was rolled.

is a disorder card found within the Spidicules Expansion.

Card Text.
You are irrationally scared by tiny spiders and the things they produce.

You cannot carry any gear with the amber keyword. You cannot gain any resources with the silk keyword.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Your experiences have left you shaken and paralyzed by fear.

Whenever you end your act adjacent to a monster, you are knocked down.

is a settlement event card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.
Card Text.
The settlement engages in games of skill. Each player nominates a different survivor. Every nominated survivor determines their score for each possible contest. Survivors' score determines their place. If the settlement only has 1 survivor, do not roll. They realize they have been competing against themselves and gain +3 insanity, a random disorder, and the Last Man Standing fighting art.

Race Contest | Score: 1d10 + Movement Attribute.

Debate Contest | Score: 1d10 + Understanding.

Fight Contest | Score: 1d10 + Strength Attribute.

If one survivor gets 4th place for all events, they are banished from the settlement and considered dead.

is a disorder card found within the Lion God Expansion.

Card Text.
If you're not killing something, you're wasting your time.

When you spend , you may only activate weapons.

is a disorder card found within the Lion Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
Your mother always said you were born under a bad sign.

You cannot critically wound.

is a disorder card found within the Dung Beetle Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
You love insects.

While there is a Bug Patch terrain tile on the showdown board, you are so overwhelmed that you are doomed.

Notes.
This card erroneously refers to the Bug Patch terrain tile as the "Bug Spot". This error was corrected in the release of the Legendary Card Pack and the 1.6 release of the Dung Beetle Knight expansion.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Even the lightest armor rubs harshly against your skin and constricts your ability to move.

You cannot wear armor at the body location. If you are wearing armor at the body location when you gain this disorder, archive it as you tear it off your person!

is a Watcher hit location card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.
Card Text.
Failure.
Small explosions of light rapidly flicker over the Watcher's surface, setting off violent seizures in the attacker's brain.

If the attacker has 3 disorders, they are knocked down and gain 1 bleeding token. Otherwise they gain 1 random disorder.

Perform Basic Action, target the attacker.

is a Watcher hit location card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.
Card Text.
Failure.
Gouts of viscous ichor reflexively shoot from the folds of the Watcher.

Attacker gains a random disorder.

Perform Basic Action, target the attacker.

is a Screaming Antelope hit location card found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.
Card Text.
TRAP! - Reshuffle Hit Location Deck.
The Screaming Antelope panics, its under-mouth unleashing an inhuman wail. It bucks wildly and leaps into the air.

The attacker is doomed. All survivors adjacent to the monster suffer 2 brain damage per monster level, knockback 5, and are knocked down.

The monster lands on its belly and begins to slide on its teeth. Turn the monster directly away from the attacker and full move forward in a straight line. On collision, non-deaf survivors gain 1 random disorder in addition to normal collision rules.

Wailing Smoke is a basic hunt event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Event Text.
A constant moan follows the survivors. Eventually, they enter an area shrouded in thick fog and the wailing reaches a fevered pitch.

Every non-deaf survivor rolls 1d10. If all survivors are deaf, they continue along, heedless to the cacophony: end this event. The lowest scoring survivor (or survivors, in case of ties) becomes a straggler. Each straggler rolls 1d10. If any survivor has noisy gear, the straggler adds +2 to their roll.

If any survivor has noisy gear and the settlement has Drums, they counter the wails with a tune from home. Do not roll on the table and each survivor gains +2 insanity and +2 survival.

is a disorder card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
You have an imaginary infirmity.

When you gain this disorder, roll a random hit location and record it. You cannot depart unless you have armor at this hit location.

is a disorder card found within the Gambler's Chest Expansion.
Card Text.
Things cannot be the way you wish them to be, and only death can shake you from you wallowing.

You cannot depart unless you have updated the death count this lantern year.

' is the White Lion Scout Discovery. It is found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion.
Card text.
Gain the White Lion Tablet scout gear.

The survivors discover a purposefully hollowed out tree. Inside, they find a carefully arranged cache of rotting body parts, broken lanterns, and crude braids of hair. They are repulsed by the gore, but the scout is further troubled. These trifles are not food. Could the monster be sentimental? Roll 1d10.
